title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message:
Hello Everybody

Working on 820-2915 come my desk not green light problem. Some one tried fix board . No voltage on PPBUS_G3H and replaced U7000 nothing changed.
After removed F7040 [U]green light come back[/U], then i inject 12.5V PPBUS_G3H line fan spin 3 sec. than stop loop .

Note: When i connected battery green or orange light not come only battery disconnected green light turns on.

Now where can i check next step?

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: F7040 pin 1 is 12,5V when removed fuse. But when put back fuse no green light. ( No short a ground PPBUS_G3H line )

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27//28 of U7000? Voltage on pin 2?

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: 17/18 resistance is 3.4Ohm , 27/28 resistance is 22Ohm . Pin 2 is 14.8V

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message:
Hello again
After replacement Q7080 green light is ok and put back F7040. ( Also battery charging turn light orange ) but still power turn on off loop continue :(

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: R7005 should be 20 ohm, check if it is correct....

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: oh wait, is your charger original 85W???

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: On/off does not spell anything good. Was the ROM messed with? Inspect for missing components. Could be many things.

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message:
Yes original 85W charger (tested 17" Macbook PRO without battery its runs ).

Re flash SPI but nothing changed :( 

PPVRTC_G3H is 3v stable , PM_SLP_L is 3.3v  ( when 3.3V fan spins) 1 sec. later turns 0V maybe give any idea about next step

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: The board was messed with so at this point it can be anything. CPU Vcore coming on when the fan spins?

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message:
Yes know its could be anythings but spend too much time and now want to solve problem...

No CPU VCore Duke

title: 820-2915 Power on & off loop
message: ALL_SYS power good line coming high when fan spins? If not one of the power rails is missing.
